thread.title: Coronation Street filming HALTED as Storm Doris rages on Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent in Manchester
thread.title_full: Coronation Street filming HALTED as Storm Doris rages on Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent in Manchester

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Coronation Street filming HALTED as Storm Doris rages on Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent in Manchester
text:
Coronation Street filming HALTED as Storm Doris rages on Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent in Manchester Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent got rained off this morning Share Storm Doris causes Coronation Street location filming to be cancelled (Photo: Eamon and James Clarke) Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
It appears filming of Coronation Street had to be cancelled this morning as Storm Doris raged down on Manchester. 
Helen Flanagan , who plays Rosie Webster and Brooke Vincent, who plays her on-screen sister Sophie, were spotted struggling to rehearse in the wind and rain this morning. 
Winds of up to 80mph will batter the north today along with heavy rain causing a risk of flooding. 
The girls were left shivering in their ripped jeans and crop tops and quickly wrapped up in red puffa jackets with hoods – provided by ITV studios. Helen Flanagan struggles to film Corrie while Storm Doris rages (Photo: Eamonn and James Clarke) Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent wrapped up in red ITV studio coats (Photo: Eamonn and James Clarke) 
They tried to practice their scene on the rain-soaked streets but the weather soon made it impossible. 
The girls then retreated with staff holding golf umbrellas over their heads to try and keep the rain off them. 
They both looked gutted that they’d not been able to complete their scenes. 
Mirror Online have contacted ITV for a comment. Staff held umbrellas for the girls (Photo: Eamonn and James Clarke) Brooke struggled to keep warm (Photo: Mark Campbell/MCPIX) 
Last night, Corrie viewers were left seriously baffled. 
Leanne gave birth to a baby this past week, and during the latest episode she got to bring her little miracle home for the first time. 
However, the sheer size of her adorable little one made viewers wonder just how long Leanne had been at the hospital for... Fans worried the baby was too big Coronation street fans complained the baby was too old to play a newborn (Photo: ITV) 
"Could #Corrie really not get a newborn baby? That's the oldest newborn that I've ever seen. So unrealistic," ranted one fan. 
A second confused fan said: "Leanne's given birth to the only baby old enough to qualify for a State Pension. #Corrie" 
"That baby looks about 25. #corrie," joked another. 
Earlier this week, viewers were distracted by some major flaws in the storyline as Leanne Battersby gave birth to her baby just minutes after going into labour - while trapped in a lift with her sister Toyah. 
Noticeably, there was also no mess following the birth with the baby looking super clean as Leanne held it in her arms - and other viewers demanded to know who cut the umbilical cord from around the baby's neck . Like us on Facebook
